inclusion.criterion: Angiography within 17 weeks of randomization showing patient is at high risk for coronary artery disease but not a candidate for coronary artery graft surgery
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Men and women ages 21 through 67 years
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Mean plasma cholesterol levels from the first two screening visits in the range of 190 to 270 mg/dL
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Smokers are admitted, but encouraged to stop smoking tobacco
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Hypertension, diabetes, thyroid disease, liver dysfunction, renal insufficiency, congestive heart failure, major arrhythmia, left ventricular conduction defects
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Physical impairment that may interfere with participation
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Life threatening disease with high likelihood of disability or death during the trial period
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Use of hydralazine, guanethidine, lipid-lowering drugs, estrogens, steroids, amphetamines, antibiotics, theophylline, acetaminophen (average daily use greater than ten grains), other drugs as determined by the principle investigator
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Vitamins A or D in doses greater than the Recommended Daily Allowance (RDA)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has severe stenosis in the left internal carotid artery and moderate stenosis in the right internal carotid artery, which may interfere with participation. He also uses no lipid-lowering medications.
